basics.name: Tse-Sheng(Jason) Nan
basics.summary: As a CS graduate student at the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign, I am a dedicated machine learning practitioner. My primary focus lies in reinforcement learning and computer vision, demonstrated through my research paper, Action-Constrained Imitation Learning. My technical expertise is further highlighted in projects like 3D Reconstruction from Road Markers, where I inferred the speed of a self-driving car. Beyond technical skills, I bring strong leadership experience, enabling me to lead effectively while thriving as a collaborative team player in any work environment.

work.name: Trend Micro
work.summary: Utilized various machine learning techniques for data analysis and employed effective storytelling strategies, driving a 63% revenue increase for a new product.

courses: Computer Vision: from recognition to geometry
Introduction to the Internet of Things

volunteer.summary: Lead organizer for the New York City branch of the People's Climate March, the largest climate march in history.
highlights: Awarded 'Climate Hero' award by Greenpeace for my efforts organizing the march.
Men of the year 2014 by Time magazine
